what: 1. The principle of the information consistency-based measures
title: Information Consistency-Based Measures for Spatial Association
text: \[ I_{N}\left(d,s\right) = \frac{\left(d,s\right)}{\left(d\right)} = \frac{\left(d\right) - \left(d \mid s\right)}{\left(d\right)} = 1 - \frac{\sum_{s_i \S}\sum_{x \V_d} p\left(s_i,x\right) \log p\left(x \mid s_i\right)}{\sum_{x \V_d} p\left(x\right) \log p\left(x\right)} \] \(p\left(x\right)\) probability observing \(x\) \(U\), \(p\left(s_i,x\right)\) probability observing \(s_i\) \(x\) \(U\), \(p\left(x \mid s_i\right)\) probability observing \(x\) given stratum \(s_i\).

what: 1. The principle of the information-theoretical V-measure
title: Information-theoretical V-measure for Spatial Association
text: Let us denote area domain . Consider two different regionalizations domain. make discussion lucid, refer first one regionalization second one partition. regionalization \(R\) divides domain \(n\) regions \(r_i \mid = 1,\ldots,n\). partition \(Z\) divides domain \(m\) zones \(z_j \mid j = 1,\ldots,n\). \(R\) \(Z\) essentially integer-type vectors equal elements. \[ h = 1 - \sum\limits_{j=1}^m \frac{A_j}{} \frac{S_j^R}{S^R} \] \(S^R = - \sum\limits_{=1}^n \frac{A_i}{} \log\frac{A_i}{}\), \(S_j^R = - \sum\limits_{=1}^n \frac{a_{,j}}{A_j} \log \frac{a_{,j}}{A_j}\), \(a_{,j}\) represents count elements \(R==\) \(Z==j\). \(A_i\) number elements vector \(R==\), \(A_j\) number elements vector \(Z==j\). swapping \(R\) \(Z\), \(c\) can calculated. Finally, v-measure can calculated useing formula: \[ V_{\beta} = \frac{(1+\beta)hc}{(\beta h) + c} \]
